      • list_sharing_accounts

        public java.lang.String list_sharing_accounts(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a request to list other accounts that share objects to the user.
        Parameters:
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers. 
         Supported parameters:
        1.limit(optional) (The amount of results requested (default is 10000)).
        2.marker(optional) (Return containers with name lexicographically after marker).
        3.format(optional) (Optional extended reply type (can be json or xml)).
 
 
         Supported header attributes:
        1.X-Auth-Token(mandatory) (The user token).
        Returns:
        A list of account names. If a format=xml or format=json argument is given, extended information on the accounts will be returned, serialized in the chosen format. For each account, the information will include the following (names will be in lower case and with hyphens replaced with underscores):
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         200(OK)-The request succeeded
 204 (No content)-The user has no access to other accounts (only for non-extended replies)

      • account_info

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> account_info(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                                                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve account related information
        Parameters:
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers. 
         Supported parameters:
 1.until(optional) (Timestamp).
 
         Supported header attributes:
 1.X-Auth-Token(mandatory).The user token.
 2.If-Modified-Since (optional).Retrieve if account has changed since provided timestamp.
 3.If-Unmodified-Since(optional.)Retrieve if account has not changed since provided timestamp.
        Returns:
        The account information contained in response header.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • list_account_containers

        public java.lang.String list_account_containers(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        List account containers
        Parameters:
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers. 
         Supported parameters:
 1.until(optional) (Timestamp).
 
         Supported header attributes:
 1.X-Auth-Token(mandatory).The user token.
 2.If-Modified-Since (optional).Retrieve if account has changed since provided timestamp.
 3.If-Unmodified-Since(optional.)Retrieve if account has not changed since provided timestamp.
        Returns:
        A string containing a list of container names with a specified format.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • update_account_metadata

        public java.lang.String update_account_metadata(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Update account metadata.
        Parameters:
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers. Supported headers: 
         1.X-Account-Group-*.Optional user defined groups.
 2.X-Account-Meta-*.Optional user defined metadata.
        Supported parameters: 
         1.update.Do not replace metadata/groups (no value parameter)
        Returns:
        No reply content/headers,only response code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         202-Accepted
 400-The metadata exceed in number the allowed account metadata or the groups exceed in number the allowed groups or the group members exceed in number the allowed group members

      • retrieve_container_info

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> retrieve_container_info(java.lang.String container,
                                                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve container metadata.
        Parameters:
        container - The container of the object(default is pithos called container).
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers. Supported headers. 
         1.If-Modified-Since.Retrieve if container has changed since provided timestamp
 2.If-Unmodified-Since.Retrieve if container has not changed since provided timestamp
        Supported request parameters. 
         1.until.Optional timestamp.
        Reply headers. 
         1.X-Container-Object-Count.The total number of objects in the container
 2.X-Container-Bytes-Used.The total number of bytes of all objects stored
 3.X-Container-Block-Size.The block size used by the storage backend
 4.X-Container-Block-Hash.The hash algorithm used for block identifiers in object hashmaps
 5.X-Container-Until-Timestamp.The last container modification date until the timestamp provided
 6.X-Container-Object-Meta.A list with all meta keys used by objects (TBD)
 7.X-Container-Policy-*.Container behavior and limits
 8.X-Container-Meta-*.Optional user defined metadata
 9.Last-Modified.The last container modification date (regardless of until)
        Returns:
        The reply headers
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         204(No content) - The request succeeded.

      • list_container_objects

        public java.lang.String list_container_objects(java.lang.String container,
                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        List container objects.
        Parameters:
        container - The container of the object(default is pithos called container).
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers.
        Supported headers. 
         1.If-Modified-Since.Retrieve if container has changed since provided timestamp
 2.If-Unmodified-Since.Retrieve if container has not changed since provided timestamp
 
         Supported request parameters.
             
 1.limit.The amount of results requested (default is 10000)
 2.marker.Return containers with name lexicographically after marker
 3.prefix.Return objects starting with prefix
 4.delimiter.Return objects up to the delimiter (discussion follows)
 5.path.Assume prefix=path and delimiter=/
 6.format.Optional extended reply type (can be json or xml)
 7.meta.Return objects that satisfy the key queries in the specified comma separated list (use , ! for existence queries,  for value queries, where  can be one of =, !=, <=, >=, <, >)
 8.shared.Show only objects (no value parameter)
 9.public.Show only public objects (no value parameter / avalaible only for owner requests)
 10.until.Optional timestamp.
        Reply headers. 
         1.X-Container-Block-Size.The block size used by the storage backend
 2.X-Container-Block-Hash.The hash algorithm used for block identifiers in object hashmaps
 4.Last-Modified.The last container modification date
 3.X-Container-Object-Meta.A list with all meta keys used by allowed objects (TBD)
        > If a format=xml or format=json argument is given, extended information on the objects will be returned, serialized in the chosen format. For each object, the information will include all object metadata, except user-defined (names will be in lower case and with hyphens replaced with underscores). User-defined metadata includes X-Object-Meta-*, X-Object-Manifest, Content-Disposition and Content-Encoding keys. Also, sharing directives will only be included with the actual shared objects (inherited permissions are not calculated): 
         1.name.The name of the object
 2.hash.The ETag of the object
 3.bytes.The size of the object
 4.content_type.The MIME content type of the object
 5.last_modified.The last object modification date (regardless of version)
 6.x_object_hash.The Merkle hash
 7.x_object_uuid.The object’s UUID
 8.x_object_version.The object’s version identifier
 9.x_object_version_timestamp.The object’s version timestamp
 10.x_object_modified_by.The user that committed the object’s version
 11.x_object_sharing.Object permissions (optional)
 12.Object permissions (optional).Allowed actions on object (optional)
 13.x_object_public.Object’s publicly accessible URI (optional: present if the object is public and the request user is the object owner)
        Returns:
        The response code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         200(OK) - The request succeeded.
 204(No Content) - The container has no objects (only for non-extended replies)
 304(Not Modified) - The container has not been modified
 403(Forbidden) - Public is requested but the request user is not the path owner
 412(Precondition Failed) - The condition set can not be satisfied

      • create_update_container

        public java.lang.String create_update_container(java.lang.String container,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Create/update container.
        Parameters:
        container - The container of the object(default is pithos called container).
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers.
        Request Headers: 
         1.X-Container-Policy-*.Container behavior and limits
 2.X-Container-Meta-*.Optional user defined metadata
        Returns:
        Reponse code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         201 (Created) - The container has been created
 202 (Accepted) - The request has been accepted
 413 (Request Entity Too Large) - Insufficient quota to complete the request

      • update_container_metadata

        public java.lang.String update_container_metadata(java.lang.String container,
                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Update container metadata.
        Parameters:
        container - The container of the object(default is pithos called container).
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers.
        Request Headers: 
         1.Content-Length.The size of the supplied data (optional, to upload)
 2.Content-Type.The MIME content type of the supplied data (optional, to upload)
 3.Transfer-Encoding.Set to chunked to specify incremental uploading (if used, Content-Length is ignored)
 4.X-Container-Policy-*.Container behavior and limits
 5.X-Container-Meta-*.Optional user defined metadata
        Request Parameters: 
         1.format.Optional hash list reply type (can be json or xml)
 2.update.Do not replace metadata/policy (no value parameter)
        Returns:
        The response code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         202 (Accepted) - The request has been accepted
 400 (Bad Request) - The metadata exceed in number the allowed container metadata
 413 (Request Entity Too Large) - Insufficient quota to complete the request

      • delete_container

        public java.lang.String delete_container(java.lang.String container,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Delete a specific container.
        Parameters:
        container - The container of the object(default is pithos called container).
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers.
        Request Parameters: 
         1.until.Optional timestamp
 2.delimiter.Optional delete objects starting with container name and delimiter
        Returns:
        Response code
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Return codes:
         204 (No Content) - The request succeeded
 409 (Conflict) - The container is not empty

      • retrieve_object_metadata

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> retrieve_object_metadata(java.lang.String filename,
                                                                                        java.lang.String container,
                                                                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                                                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                                                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve object metadata.
        Parameters:
        filename - The object name representation.
        container - The container of the object(default is pithos called container).
        parameters - The request parameters.
        headers - The request headers.
         Request Headers:
 1.If-Match.Retrieve if ETags match
 2.If-None-Match.Retrieve if ETags don’t match
 3.If-Modified-Since.Retrieve if object has changed since provided timestamp
 4.If-Unmodified-Since.Retrieve if object has not changed since provided timestamp
 
         Request Paremeters:
 1.version.Optional version identifier
 
         Response Headers:
 1.ETag.The ETag of the object
 2.Content-Length.The size of the object
 3.Content-Type.The MIME content type of the object
 4.Last-Modified.The last object modification date (regardless of version)
 5.Content-Encoding.The encoding of the object (optional)
 6.Content-Disposition.The presentation style of the object (optional)
 7.X-Object-Hash.The Merkle hash
 8.X-Object-UUID.The object’s UUID
 9.X-Object-Version.The object’s version identifier
 10.X-Object-Version-Timestamp.The object’s version timestamp
 11.X-Object-Modified-By.The user that comitted the object’s version
 12.X-Object-Manifest.Object parts prefix in /
